event_descriptions: The Governor prohibited gatherings larger than 500 people. Schools and non-essential businesses were instructed to close in the following days.
event_description_short: No gathering for 500+, schools & non-essential businesses to close shortly

event_descriptions: The Governor issued a stay-at-home order, which was subsequently extended until May 15.
The Governor instituted a mask mandate.
Five regions began reopening. New York City, however, started reopening on June 8.
event_description_short: Five regions begin to reopen, NYC follows only on Jun 8

event_descriptions: The Governor closed bars, nightclubs, and schools and added social distancing and capacity restrictions for restaurants.
event_description_short: Bars, clubs, schools closed + social distancing

event_descriptions: The Governor issued a statewide stay-at-home order, which lasted for 30 days. A partial stay-at-home order was previously implemented on March 30.
Florida began reopening some businesses and parts of the state. Florida entered Full Phase 1 of reopening on May 18.
event_description_short: Some businesses start to reopen, full phase 1 on May 18

event_descriptions: The Governor ordered bars to be closed due to recent spikes.
event_description_short: Bars ordered to close due to spikes

event_descriptions: The Governor lifted all statewide COVID-19 restrictions, including allowing bars and restaurants to return to 100% capacity.
The Governor closed schools. Restrictions on restaurants and bars and mass gatherings were implemented in the following days.
event_description_short: Schools closed, other restrictions followed shortly

event_descriptions: The Department of Health Services issued a stay-at-home order, which was subsequently extended until May 26.
Wisconsin Supreme Court overturned the stateâ€™s stay-at-home order. Some businesses (e.g. bars) began reopening shortly thereafter.
event_description_short: SAH overturned by Wis Supreme Court, bars open shortly after

event_descriptions: The Governor instituted a mask mandate. A new mask mandate was issued on Sept. 22 that will last until Nov. 21.
event_description_short: Mask mandate instituted, renewed on Sep 27 until Nov 21

event_descriptions: The Governor ordered the Department of Health Services to limit indoor public gatherings.
event_description_short: DoHS order to limit indoor public gatherings

event_descriptions: Voluntary national shutdown instituted, limiting mass gatherings to 10 or less people, advising against discretionary travel, and recommending closure of schools, restaurants, gyms, and other indoor or outdoor venues. This shutdown was extended through April 30.
The White House released guidelines for state governors and local authorities to reopen the country.
event_description_short: Guidelines to reopen the country released
